abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Road Sector Support
            Project for Cabo Verde were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was moderately satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            project readiness is essential for smooth implementation.
            Deficient engineering design in civil works often leads to
            major cost overruns. For isolated small islands, it is
            necessary to explore first the soundness of using the
            locally available construction materials in order to have
            better efficiency. Whenever possible, combining development
            lending operations with sector specific projects creates
            useful synergies. There is a need to support the
            decision-making process for the development and
            rehabilitation of low-volume rural roads with customized
            economic evaluation tool.
